TEXT.English: I must not fear. Fear is the mind-killer. Fear is the little-death that brings total obliteration. I will face my fear. I will permit it to pass over me and through me. And when it has gone past I will turn the inner eye to see its path. Where the fear has gone there will be nothing. Only I will remain. - The Bene Gesserit Litany Against Fear

TEXT.English: And visible far off to the left across the plain stood the awesome pile of plasteel which Paul had built as his fortress - his "sietch above the sand." It was the largest integrated single construction ever to rise from the hand of man. Entire cities could have been housed within its walls and room to spare. - from Children of Dune

TEXT.English: Idaho's hands went to his console, fingers splayed in the comfield to grasp required elements of the circuit control. No time for niceties. Gross disruption. He was into the core within a second. From there, it was a simple matter to dump entire segments. Navigation went first. He saw the net begin to thin, the look of surprise on the man's face. Nullfields were next. Idaho felt the ship lurching in foldspace. The net tipped, becoming elongated with the two watchers foreshortened and thinned. Idaho wiped out star-memory circuits, taking his own data with them. - from Chapterhouse: Dune

TEXT.English: If you are numbered among "the heartfelt pilgrims," you will cross the last thousand meters of this approach to the Temple of Alia on your knees. Those thousand meters fall well within the sweeping curves leading your eyes up to the transcendent symbols dedicating this Temple to St. Alia of the Knife. The famed "Sun-Sweep Window" incorporates every solar calendar known to human history in the one translucent display whose brilliant colors, driven by the sun of Dune, thread through the interior on prismatic pathways.

TEXT.English: There exists no separation between gods and men; one blends softly casual to the other. - Proverbs of Muad'Dib
TEXT.French: "Il n'existe pas de barrières entre les Dieux et les Hommes ; Les uns se mélangent occasionnellement aux autres." - Proverbe de Muad'Dib

TEXT.English: The people need their faith. Yes, they need it like bread or water or air. Let us never stand in the way of the people's faith, let us instead accept it and encourage it. For then the people will accept us as their rulers without question or rebellion. Remember, rulership can not go against the will of the people, it can only guide that will. And that will is a great power that must be harnessed.

And that will is a great power that must be harnessed.

TEXT.English: May all beings everywhere, Seen and unseen, Dwelling far off or nearby, Being or waiting to become: May all be filled with lasting joy. - Mahayana Christian prayer

TEXT.English: The sietch at the desert's rim Was Liet's, was Kynes's, Was Stilgar's, was Muad'Dib's And once more, was Stilgar's. The Naibs one by one sleep in the sand, But the sietch endures. - from a Fremen song
TEXT.French: "Le Sietch au bord du désert, a été celui de Liet, celui de Kynes, celui de Stilgar, celui de Muad'Dib, et une fois encore celui de Stilgar. Les Naibs un par un dorment à présent dans le sable, Mais le Sietch, lui, perdure." - extrait d'une chanson Fremen
TEXT.German: The sietch at the desert's rim Was Liet's, was Kynes's, Was Stilgar's, was Muad'Dib's And once more, was Stilgar's. The Naibs one by one sleep in the sand, But the sietch endures. - from a Fremen song

TEXT.English: The Great Revolt took away a crutch, It forced human minds to develop. Schools were started to train human talents. We have two chief survivors of those ancient schools: the Bene Gesserit and the Spacing Guild. The Guild, so we think, emphasizes almost pure mathematics. Bene Gesserit performs another function. - Gaius Helen Mohiam

TEXT.English: The one-eyed view of our universe says you must not look far afield for problems. Such problems may never arrive. Instead, tend to the wolf within your fences. The packs ranging outside may not even exist. - The Azhar Book; Shamra I:4
TEXT.French: "La Vue de notre univers nous enseigne de ne pas chercher des problèmes trop loin. Ces problèmes lointains n'arrivent jamais. Par contre, les Loups sont plus souvent à l'intérieur de nos frontières. Ceux situé en dehors n'existent peut-être pas." - Le Livre d'Azhar; Shamra I:4
TEXT.German: The one-eyed view of our universe says you must not look far afield for problems. Such problems may never arrive. Instead, tend to the wolf within your fences. The packs ranging outside may not even exist. - The Azhar Book; Shamra I:4

TEXT.English: Chemical explosives provides some powerful offensive weapons, including the first siege units. Research this tech if you want to conquer enemy cities, or to counter enemy melee units. Provides a powerful early game unit for Ix, if they have also reached Offworld Trade and begun to import Ixian Technology.

TEXT.English: The landscape of the planet Dune is a very harsh one. Yet native flaura and fauna still exist and can be found by those with the eyes of desert experience. It is even possible, with great care and attention, to cultivate certain plants and animals in some kinds of Dune terrain. It takes great patience and knowledge.

TEXT.English: The thing the ecologically illiterate don't realize about an ecosystem is that it's a system. A system! A system maintains a certain fluid stability that can be destroyed by a misstep in just one niche. A system has order, a flowing from point to point. If something dams the flow, order collapses. The untrained miss the collapse until too late. That's why the highest function of ecology is the understanding of consequences. - Kynes in "Appendix I: The Ecology of Dune"

TEXT.English: In this age when the means of human transport include devices which can span the deeps of space in transtime, and other devices which can carry men swiftly over virtually impassable planetary surfaces, it seems odd to think of attempting long journeys afoot. yet this remains a primary means of travel on Arrakis, a fact attributed partly to preference and partly to the brutal treatment which this planet reserves for anything mechanical. In the strictures of Arrakis, human flesh remains the most durable and reliable resource for the Hajj. Perhaps it is the implicit awareness of this fact which makes Arrakis the ultimate mirror of the soul. -Handbook of the Hajj
TEXT.French: "A cette époque où certains moyens de transport conçus par les hommes peuvent atteindre les profondeurs de l'espace instantanément, et d'autres transporter aisément des hommes à travers toutes les de la planète, mais celles réputées infranchissables, il peut paraître surprenant de continuer à mener de long voyages à pied. La marche reste le principal moyen de déplacement sur Arrakis. Par préférence, mais également en raison du traitement impitoyable que la Planète fait subir à tout ce qui est mécanique. Dans les contrées désolées d'Arrakis, la chair humaine reste la ressource la plus durable et fiable pour le Hajj. Peut-être que c'est la conscience implicite de ce fait qui fait d'Arrakis le miroir ultime de l'âme. " - Journal du Hajj

TEXT.English:
The nobility of the Imperium have ruled for millenia. Each Noble House rules one or more planets and has a seat in the Landsraad Assembly. Then there are the minor noble Houses, with more limited spheres of influence and power, owing allegiance to their more powerful patrons. Then there are various merchant guilds and other organisations who operate in various ways, sometimes across entire sectors of space, and sometimes just locally on one planet. And then, of course, there are the common people, the subjects in their trillions. They live their lives paying their taxes and wondering if those lofty powers who rule them are even aware of their concerns and tribulations. This is the way it has been and this is the way it will always be.
Faufreluches is a term commonly used to describe the class system of the Imperium. The faufreluche system provides some sort of order for the way in which humanity relates with one another, both to maintain order and civility, and to keep certain groups under control within the Imperium. However, it attempts to minimise alienation of individuals or minorities by catering for everyone. The catchphrase of the faufreluche system is "A place for every man and every man in his place."

TEXT.English: This social tech allows the Faufreluches civic, which supports a powerful specialist economy. A specialist economy works well with Arrakis Spice civic and Water Discipline civic; Arrakis spice gives you income sources without needing to work many tiles, while water discipline provides enough water from a few tiles that you have citizens to spare to work as specialists.

TEXT.English: Humans live best when each has his place to stand, when each knows where he belongs in the scheme of things and what he may achieve. Destroy the place and you destroy the person. - Bene Gesserit Teaching
TEXT.French: "Les Humains vivent mieux lorsque chacun a une place ou se tenir, lorsque chacun sait où il se trouve dans l'ordre de choses et ce qu'il peut accomplir. Supprimez sa place, et vous détruirez la personne." - Enseignement Bene Gesserit

TEXT.English: Mentats: humans trained in pure mathematics and logical computation using deep forms of trance and life long mental training. They are human computers relied on to answer complex computational problems. The mentats were developed so that never again should Thinking Machines arise to enslave Humanity.

TEXT.English: The Fedaykin were Paul's most loyal group of Fremen warriors, who guarded him with their lives. They were his Death Commandos, utterly fearless in battle and able to sweep lesser troops aside. Such is the power of fanaticism. With the courage of a soaring heart and a certain mind, anything can be achieved.

TEXT.English: Enter no conflict against fanatics unless you can defuse them. Oppose a religion with another religion only if your proofs (miracles) are irrefutable or if you can mesh in a way that the fanatics accept you as god-inspired. - Missionaria Protectiva, Primary Teaching

TEXT.English: Even though thinking machines were prohibited, mans quest for knowledge is never-ending. Following the words of the Orange Catholic Bible, man has no longer made "a machine in the likeness of a human mind." However that does not mean that education has become stagnant. The brightest minds of the galaxy gather in Academies yet again, unearthing a tradition that was thought to be long dead. For where there are those who wish to learn, there will always be a place for them to study within the walls of the Academy.
TEXT.French: Even though thinking machines were prohibited, mans quest for knowledge is never-ending. Following the words of the Orange Catholic Bible, man has no longer made "a machine in the likeness of a human mind." However that does not mean that education has become stagnant. The brightest minds of the galaxy gather in Academies yet again, unearthing a tradition that was thought to be long dead. For where there are those who wish to learn, there will always be a place for them to study within the walls of the Academy.

TEXT.English:
SHIELD, DEFENSIVE: the protective field produced by a Holtzman generator. This field derives from Phase One of the suspensor-nullification effect. A shield will permit entry only to objects moving at slow speeds (depending on setting, this speed ranges from six to nine centimeters per second) and can be shorted out only by a shire-sized electric field. (See Lasgun.)
HOLTZMAN EFFECT: the negative repelling effect of a shield generator. - Dune Appendix

TEXT.English: There is no open standing water on the planet Arrakis, otherwise known as Dune. There is moisture in the air, however. Wind Traps were designed to capture and extract that precious moisture. Without wind traps, it is doubtful there would be any human population living on Arrakis.

TEXT.English: There was this drylander who was asked which was more important, a literjon of water or a vast pool of water? The drylander thought a moment and then said: "The literjon is more important. No single person could own a great pool of water. But a literjon you could hide under your cloak and run away with it. No one would know. - The Jokes of Ancient Dune, Bene Gesserit Archives
TEXT.French: On demanda à un Nomade ce qui était le plus important entre une outre d'eau et un vaste étang d'eau ? Après un moment, le Nomade dit : "L'outre est plus importante : Personne ne peut posséder une grande étendue d'eau. Par contre, vous pouvez dissimuler l'outre sous votre cape et disparaître avec, sans que personne ne s'en rende compte. - Blagues de l'Ancient Dune, Archives Bene Gesserit

TEXT.English:
In ages long past, the Zensunni were followers of the teachings of Maometh, the "Third Muhammed". But we broke away to form a new sect, seeking a new path to enlightenment. Yes, we sought to return to the ways of our fathers. We again remembered the truth of Buddallah, the One, whose word has always been rendered to us by the prophets. Ali Ben Ohashi was our first leader; his light was incandescant amongst the stars.
We wandered throughout the galaxy from our first home on Poritrin, finding many new homes but never peace. For peace lies within the self. Salusa Secundis, Bela Tegeuse, Harmonthep, Arrakis, all these worlds were part of our journeys. But the real journey lies inside.
May Buddallah guide you in your journey to peace.

TEXT.English: Most importantly, Offworld trade makes Spice valuable. (Discovery of the tech places a national wonder 'Spice off-world trade' in your capital, which consumes Spice for a whole lotta commerce!) The first civ which discovers Offworld trade founds CHOAM, the Combine Honnete Ober Advancer Mercantiles corporation. (Treated as a religion.) Offworld trade allows the purchase of units from it's civ's homeworld (see the separate offworld purchase menu). Also allows landing stage buildings, which let you import unique special trade goods.

TEXT.English: Education is no substitute for intelligence. That elusive quality is defined only in part by puzzle-solving ability. It is in the creation of new puzzles reflecting what your senses report that you round out the definitions. - Mentat Text One

TEXT.English: Flying has been a dream of man since he saw the birds float seamlessly in on the winds. Since man has reached and conquered the stars, there is nothing else now. However, not all worlds have benefitted from these advancements. As soon as Arakis was discovered by Imperial Topographers, the planet was quickly fitted with several landing zones for interstellar commerce. The focus on air superiority can be a lucrative thing, since flying is safer than walking out into the open desert.

TEXT.English: Beyond a critical point within a finite space, freedom diminishes as numbers increase. This is as true of humans in the finite space of a planetary ecosystem as it is of gas molecules in a sealed flask. The human question is not how many can possibly survive within the system, but what kind of existence is possible for those who do survive. - Pardot Kynes, First Planetologist of Arrakis
TEXT.French: "Considérant un espace fini, La liberté diminue à mesure que le nombre augmente, jusqu'à un point critique. Ceci est valable aussi bien pour des humains que pour un écosystème planétaire en tant que molécules dans une espace clos. La question pour les humains n'est pas de savoir combien peuvent survivre dans ce système, mais quelle existence est possible pour ceux qui survivent." - Pardot Kynes, Premier Planétologue d'Arrakis
TEXT.German: Beyond a critical point within a finite space, freedom diminishes as numbers increase. This is as true of humans in the finite space of a planetary ecosystem as it is of gas molecules in a sealed flask. The human question is not how many can possibly survive within the system, but what kind of existence is possible for those who do survive. - Pardot Kynes, First Planetologist of Arrakis

This is as true of humans in the finite space of a planetary ecosystem as it is of gas molecules in a sealed flask. TEXT.Spanish: Beyond a critical point within a finite space, freedom diminishes as numbers increase. TEXT.English: Good government never depends upon laws, but upon the personal qualities of those who govern. The machinery of government is always subordinate to the will of those who administer that machinery. The most important element of government, therefore, is the method of choosing leaders. - Law and Governance, The Spacing Guild Manual
TEXT.French: "Les bons gouvernements ne sont pas caractérisés par des lois, mais par les qualités peronnelles de leur dirigeants. La machinerie gouvernementale est toujours soumise à la volonté de ceux qui contrôlent cette machinerie. L'élément le plus important d'un gouvernement, c'est donc sa méthode pour choisir ses dirigeants." - Loi et gouvernance, Manuel de la Guilde spatiale
TEXT.German: Good government never depends upon laws, but upon the personal qualities of those who govern. The machinery of government is always subordinate to the will of those who administer that machinery. The most important element of government, therefore, is the method of choosing leaders. - Law and Governance, The Spacing Guild Manual

The most important element of government, therefore, is the method of choosing leaders. - Law and Governance, The Spacing Guild Manual

TEXT.English: The failure of CHOAM? Quite simple: They ignore the fact that larger commercial powers wait at the edges of their activities, powers that could swallow them the way a slig swallows garbage. - Bene Gesserit Council notes, Archives #SXX9OCH

TEXT.English: Behold the Imperium of Man! Spanning countless worlds across the interstellar night, trillions of souls living out their existances. It is vast, yet it is governed. Always remember that the Imperium rests on three great foundations: the Padishah Emperor, ruler of known space; the Landsraad, the assembly of Noble Houses; the Spacing Guild, with their monopoly on all space travel. This is the way it has been for thousands upon thousands of years. The balance between these three is what keeps the Imperium intact.

TEXT.English: No matter how exotic human civilization becomes, no matter the developments of life and society nor the complexity of the machine/human interface, there always come interludes of lonely power when the course of humankind, the very future of humankind, depends on the relatively simple actions of single individuals. -from The Tleilaxu Godbuk
TEXT.French: "Peu importe si la civilization humaine devient exotique, peu importe les développement de la vie et de la société et la complexité de l'interface homme/machine, il arrive toujours des interludes de pouvoir solitaire, lorsque le cours de l'humanité et son futur, dépend d'actions simples d'individus solitaires." -extrait du Godbuk Tleilaxu
TEXT.German: No matter how exotic human civilization becomes, no matter the developments of life and society nor the complexity of the machine/human interface, there always come interludes of lonely power when the course of humankind, the very future of humankind, depends on the relatively simple actions of single individuals. -from The Tleilaxu Godbuk

TEXT.English: We must do a thing on Arrakis never before attempted for an entire planet. We must use man as a constructive ecological force -- inserting adapted terraform life: a plant here, an animal there, a man in that place -- to transform the water cycle, to build a new kind of landscape. - Report from Pardot Kynes to Emperor Elrood IX
TEXT.French: "Nous devons faire sur Arrakis quelque-chose que nous n'avons jamais tenté pour une planète entière. Nous devons utilisé l'homme en tant que force constructive écologique -- implanter au bon endroit la forme de vie adaptée : une plante ici, un animal là, un homme à cette emplacement -- pour transformer le cycle de l'eau, pour construire un nouveau style de paysage." - Rapport de Pardot Kynes à l'Empereur Elrood IX
TEXT.German: We must do a thing on Arrakis never before attempted for an entire planet. We must use man as a constructive ecological force -- inserting adapted terraform life: a plant here, an animal there, a man in that place -- to transform the water cycle, to build a new kind of landscape. - Report from Pardot Kynes to Emperor Elrood IX
TEXT.Italian: We must do a thing on Arrakis never before attempted for an entire planet. We must use man as a constructive ecological force -- inserting adapted terraform life: a plant here, an animal there, a man in that place -- to transform the water cycle, to build a new kind of landscape. - Report from Pardot Kynes to Emperor Elrood IX

We must use man as a constructive ecological force -- inserting adapted terraform life: a plant here, an animal there, a man in that place -- to transform the water cycle, to build a new kind of landscape. - Report from Pardot Kynes to Emperor Elrood IX

TEXT.English: House Atreides pioneered the use of the Ornithopter in the Arakian conflict, giving them an initial edge over the other houses. Even though the desert winds are somewhat of a concern, an experienced pilot can avoid them with enough experience. Aerial warfare quickly becomes invaluable in the Arakian conflict, harvesters being a main target for clever commanders who want to disrupt the enemys economy.

TEXT.English: The resettled technicians and mechanics of Richese naturally turned to machine technology as one way to occupy their time, taking great care to avoid the development of population controlling machines. There was some early resistance to this technology, but as the decades passed and the planet remained alone in a forgotten corner of the universe, decisive steps in the rebirth of truly sophisticated technology were taken. - Hadi Benotto, the Dune Encyclopedia

TEXT.English: The escalation of the Arakis conflcit has led several of the Great Houses to seriously consider Air Superiority as a viable doctrine. This has led to several young officers presenting new ideas in academies all over the empire. It seems the Atreides thopters will no longer be the only flying machines on Dune.

TEXT.English: Technology, in common with many other activities, tends toward avoidance of risks by investors. Uncertainty is ruled out if possible. Capital investment follows this rule, since people generally prefer the predictable. Few recognize how destructive this can be, how it imposes severe limits on variability and thus makes whole populations fatally vulnerable to the shocking ways our universe can throw the dice. -Assessment of Ix, Bene Gesserit Archives
TEXT.French: "La Technologie, ainsi que beaucoup d'autres activités, tend à éviter les risques pour les investisseurs. in common with many other activities, tends toward avoidance of risks by investors. L'incertitude est exclue si c'est possible. Les investissements en capital suivent cette règle, puisque les gens préfèrent généralement un avenir prévisible. Peu reconnaissent à quel point c'est destructif, comme cette règle impose des limites de variabilité, entraînant des populations entières, fatalement vulnérables aux chemins tortueux que notre univers nous réserve." - Devise Ix, Archives Bene Gesserit

TEXT.English: When I am weaker than you, I ask for freedom because that is according to your principles; when I am stronger than you, I take away your freedom because that is according to my principles. - Words of an ancient philosopher (Attributed by Harq al-Ada to one Louis Veuillot)
TEXT.French: "Lorsque je suis plus faible que vous, Je vous demande la liberté car c'est en accord avec vos principes ; Lorsque je suis plus puissant, je vous prive de votre liberté car c'est en accords avec mes principes." - Paroles d'un ancient philosophe (Attribué par Harq al-Ada à Louis Veuillot)
TEXT.German: When I am weaker than you, I ask for freedom because that is according to your principles; when I am stronger than you, I take away your freedom because that is according to my principles. - Words of an ancient philosopher (Attributed by Harq al-Ada to one Louis Veuillot)

TEXT.English: Where Otheym's house had been there stood now a pillar of fire, a blinding jet roaring at the heavens. It gave off a dirty brilliance which threw into sharp relief every ballet movement of the fighting and fleeing men, the tipping retreat of ornithopters. - from Dune Messiah

TEXT.English: "It's basically a micro-sandwich - a high-efficiency filter and heat-exchange system. The skin-contact layer's porous. Perspiration passes through it, having cooled the body... near-normal evaporation process. The next two layers... include heat exchange filaments and salt precipitators. Salt's reclaimed. Motions of the body, especially breathing and some osmotic action provide the pumping force. Reclaimed water circulates to catchpockets from which you draw it through this tube in the clip at your neck." - Liet-Kynes

TEXT.English: The sandcrawler directly in front of you dates from the Atreides times. Grouped around it, moving clockwise from your left, are a small harvester, a carryall, a primitive spice factory and the other support equipment. All are explained at each station. Note the illuminated quotation above the display: "FOR THEY SHALL SUCK OF THE ABUNDANCE OF THE SEAS AND OF THE TREASURE IN THE SAND." This ancient religious quotation was oft repeated by the famous Gurney Halleck. - Guide Announcement, Museum of Dar-es-Balat
TEXT.French: "Le Char des Sables en face de vous date des temps Atréides. Tout autour, de gauche à droite, une petite moissonneuse, un Carryall, une raffinerie d'Epice primitive et d'autre l'équipements de maintenance. Tout sera détaillé à chaque station. Remarquez la citation au-dessus de l'écran : "CAR ILS ASPIRENT L'ABONDANCE DES MERS ET LE TRESOR DU SABLE." Cette ancienne citation religieuse était très souvent répétée par le célèbre Gurney Halleck." - Extrait du discours du Guide, Musée de Dar-es-Balat

TEXT.English: The working planetologist has access to many resources, data and projections. However, his most important tools are human beings. Only by cultivating economy literacy among the people themselves can he save an entire planet. - Pardot Kynes
TEXT.French: Le planétologue en activité a accès à beaucoup de ressources, données et projections. Cependant, son outil le plus important est les consciences humaines. The working planetologist has access to many resources, data and projections. However, his most important tools are human beings. Ce n'est qu'en cultivant l'alphabétisation des gens eux-mêmes que l'on peut espérer sauver une planète entière. - Pardot Kynes
TEXT.German: The working planetologist has access to many resources, data and projections. However, his most important tools are human beings. Only by cultivating economy literacy among the people themselves can he save an entire planet. - Pardot Kynes

TEXT.English: Arrakis... Dune... desert planet. There is not one drop of free standing water on this planet. It is a harsh place that teaches harsh rules if you want to survive it. The Fremen have learnt these rules very well. They do not understand comfort and luxury. It is this that has made them strong. To prosper on this planet the skills of desert survival are essential.

TEXT.English: Downwind sides of old dunes provided the first plantation areas. The Fremen aimed first for a cycle of poverty grass with peatlike hair cilia to intertwine, mat and fix the dunes by depriving the wind of its big weapon: movable grains. - Appendix I: The Ecology of Dune

TEXT.English: "Each bush, each weed you see out there in the erg, how do you suppose it lives when we leave it? Each is planted most tenderly in its own little pit. The pits are filled with smooth ovals of chromoplastic. Light turns them white. You can see them glistening in the dawn if you look down from a high place. White reflects. But when Old Father Sun departs, the chromoplastic reverts to transparency in the dark. It cools with extreme rapidity. The surface condenses moisture out of the air. That moisture trickles down to keep our plants alive." - Harah, wife of Jamis

TEXT.English: Beneath them, the broken ground began to drop away in tumbled creases toward a barren rock plain and a knife-edged shelf. Beyond the shelf, fingernail crescents of dunes marched toward the horizon with here and there in the distance a dull smudge, a darker blotch to tell of something not sand. - from Dune

TEXT.English: Governments, if they endure, always tend increasingly toward aristocratic forms. No government in history has been known to evade this pattern. And as the aristocracy develops, government tends more and more to act exclusively in the interests of the ruling class - whether that class be hereditary royalty, oligarchs of financial empires, or entrenched bureaucracy. - Politics as Repeat Phenomenon : Bene Gesserit Training Manual
TEXT.French: "Les gouvernements, s'ils perdurent, prennent progressivement des formes aristocratiques. Aucun gouvernement dans l'Histoire n'a échappé à ce schéma. et comme l'aristocracie se développe, le gouvernment à tendance à agir de plus en plus pour les seuls intérets de la classe dirigeante - que ce soit une royauté héréditaire, des oligarches d'empires financiers, ou une bureaucratie." - La Politique, un phénomène répété : Manuel Bene Gesserit
TEXT.German: Governments, if they endure, always tend increasingly toward aristocratic forms. No government in history has been known to evade this pattern. And as the aristocracy develops, government tends more and more to act exclusively in the interests of the ruling class - whether that class be hereditary royalty, oligarchs of financial empires, or entrenched bureaucracy. - Politics as Repeat Phenomenon : Bene Gesserit Training Manual
TEXT.Italian: Governments, if they endure, always tend increasingly toward aristocratic forms. No government in history has been known to evade this pattern. And as the aristocracy develops, government tends more and more to act exclusively in the interests of the ruling class - whether that class be hereditary royalty, oligarchs of financial empires, or entrenched bureaucracy. - Politics as Repeat Phenomenon : Bene Gesserit Training Manual

TEXT.English: The long table on the right is set for a banquet of roast desert hare in sauce cepeda. The other dishes, clockwise to the right from the far end of the table, are aplomage sirian, chukka under glass, coffee with melange (note the hawk crest of the Atreides on the urn), pot-a-oie and, in the Balut crystal bottle, sparkling Caladan wine. Note the ancient poison detector concealed in the chandelier. -Dar-es-Balat, Description at a Museum Display

TEXT.English: "And no man ever again shall want for water. It shall be his for dipping from well or pond or lake or canal. It shall run down through the qanats to feed our plants. It shall be there for any man to take. It shall be his for holding out his hand." - from a Fremen rite

TEXT.English: Ornithopter: The basic method of airborne travel in the Imperium. The common ornithopter was a very late development in the history of atmospheric flight. The first ornithopters, that is, vehicles that fly like birds rather than powered gliders or helicopters, were built by a team of scientists being held as political prisoners (as a result of the abortive Thinkers' Rebellion of 7600 B.G.) by Emperor Neweh in 7585 B.G. Their head was Jehane Golitle, who was placed in charge of an understaffed, underfunded, and discouraged team of scientists, and told to earn her team's continued well-being by inventing useful devices which would make a profit for the emperor.

TEXT.English: Where you find religion, you will find organisations of people, hierarchies and temples. These will spread everywhere preaching their own brand of truth, growing fat and corrupt on their wealth. The message of religion becomes lost in that babble. Let us never forget the truth that lies behind the words.

TEXT.English: When religion and politics travel in the same cart, the riders believe nothing can stand in their way. Their movement becomes headlong - faster and faster and faster. They put aside all thought of obstacles and forget that a precipice does not show itself to the man in a blind rush until it's too late. - Bene Gesserit proverb

TEXT.English:
The Spacing Guild has a monopoly on imperial banking and interstellar travel: with the use of melange, the geriatric spice, Guild Navigators are the only beings capable of piloting the massive Guild heighliners safely through space. The heightened awareness and prescience the spice grants allows the Navigator to plot a safe course between the stars. Contrary to popular belief, the navigators do not themselves 'fold' space, allowing a nearly instantaneous trip. The space-folding is accomplished by Holtzman engines activated from the navigator's chamber.
The Guild is apolitical (with exceptions), since their monopoly allows them to dictate terms to all parties that preserves the economy that supports them. As the only party able to transport goods in an interstellar economy, the Guild's highest concern is that commerce continue; for commerce to continue, the Guild must continue; for the Guild to continue, melange must be available. Ultimately, the Guild's only concern is that melange continue to be mined on Arrakis. Because spice is a requirement for long distance space transport, their motto resonates throughout the empire: "the spice must flow."

TEXT.English: The Guild Navigators were utterly dependent on the Spice Melange to safely deliver a vessel via the Holtzman Effect. Even a partial restriction on the Guild's spice requirements rendered them powerless, and reduced long distance trade and transport to a snail's pace. This was their weakness. - from Rise of the God Emperor by the Princess Irulan
TEXT.French: "Les Navigateurs de la Guilde étaient tellement dépendants à l'Epice pour dépêcher un vaisseau avec l'Effet Holtzman. Même une toute petite retenue dans les demandes d'Epice de la Guilde les rendraient impuissants, réduisant le commerce et le transport de longue distance à une allure d'escargot. C'était leur point faible." - extrait de l'Avènement du Dieu Empereur, par la Princesse Irulan
TEXT.German: The Guild Navigators were utterly dependent on the Spice Melange to safely deliver a vessel via the Holtzman Effect. TEXT.English: Even though the concept of the ablative heat shield was described as early as 1920 by Robert Goddard, its usefulness is enough to make it a viable means of defending armor battalions and ships. This is type of heat shield best protects against high heat flux. The ablative heat shield functions by lifting the hot shock layer gas away from the heat shield's outer wall (creating a cooler boundary layer) through blowing. Ablation can also provide blockage against radiative heat flux by introducing carbon into the shock layer thus making it optically opaque.

TEXT.English: Always, the exorbitant demands rode upon military ventures. "Hazard rates," the oily Guild agents explained. And for every agent you managed to insert as a watchdog in the Guild Bank structure, they put two agents into your system. - from Dune

TEXT.English: Since its inception, the taking of the Water of Life could only be conducted by women appropriately trained in prana/bindu. Any man, who had tried, had died. Bene Gesserit plans had it that the culmination of their breeding program would result in a male Bene Gesserit who could successfully convert the Water of Life. This man would be the Kwisatz Haderach. In 10193 AG, Paul Atreides was the first male to succeed in converting the the Water of Life, in a process that kindled new and immense powers in the young Atreides Duke. Before, and even after this attempt, many men had attempted the process and died. Paul had consumed only one drop of the bile, and it had put him into such a deep coma that he was believed dead. After three weeks, however, he emerged, having successfully converted the bile into the Water of Life. Along with it came many powerful abilities, such as perfect prescience. With that prescience, Paul saw the future of Humanity, a future that terrified him.

TEXT.English: In shield fighting, one moves fast on defense, slow on attack. Attack has the sole purpose of tricking the opponent into a misstep, setting him up for the attack sinister. The shield turns the fast blow, admits the slow kindjal! - Gurney Halleck, to Paul Atreides

TEXT.English: "This is a Mentat, Feyd. It has been trained and conditioned to perform certain duties. The fact that it's encased in a human body, however, must not be overlooked. A serious drawback, that. I sometimes think the ancients with their thinking machines had the right idea." - Baron Vladimir Harkonnen

TEXT.English: Due to the monopoly of the spice, finding a viable alternative gradually became the focus of certain groups - most notably the Tleilaxu. Control of the spice during the Corrino Empire was later eclipsed in scope by the God-Emperor Leto Atreides II. This led to protracted attempts to synthesize the spice, which eventually yielded positive results for the Bene Tleilax, some 1500 years after Leto II's death. As a result, the Tleilaxu became spice merchants and funded many of their endeavours through sales revenue.

TEXT.English: Few products escape the CHOAM touch, logs, donkeys, horses, cows, lumber, dung, sharks, whale fur - the most prosaic and the most exotic . . . even our poor pundi rice from Caladan. Anything the Guild will transport, the art forms of Ecaz, the machines of Richesse and Ix. But all fades before melange. A handful of spice will buy a home on Tupile. It cannot be manufactured, it must be mined on Arrakis. - Duke Leto I

TEXT.English: Either we abandon the long-horned Theory of Relativity, or we cease to believe that we can engage in continued accurate prediction of the future. Indeed, knowing the future raises a host of questions which cannot be answered under conventional assumptions unless one first projects an Observer outside of Time and, second, nullifies all movement. If you accept the Theory of Relativity, it can be shown that Time and the Observer must stand still in relationship to each or inaccuracies will intervene. This would seem to say that it is impossible to engage in accurate prediction of the future. How, then, do we explain the continued seeking after this visionary goal by respected scientists? How, then do we explain Muad'Dib? - Lectures on Prescience, By Harq al-Ada
TEXT.French: "Soit nous abandonnons la Théorie de la relativité, ou alors nous cessons de croire que nous pouvons réaliser et prédire le future. Cependant, connaître le futur nous appelle une foule de questions qui n'ont pas de réponses avec les présupposés conventionnels. Il faut pour cela faire abstraction du lien entre le temps et le mouvement, enseigné par la théorie de la Relativité. Certains prétendent qu'il est impossible de prédire le future. Comment, alors, expliquer que de respectueux scientifiques en ont fait le objectif depuis des siècles. Et Comment expliquer Muad'Dib?" - Lectures de Prescience, par Harq al-Ada

If you accept the Theory of Relativity, it can be shown that Time and the Observer must stand still in relationship to each or inaccuracies will intervene. TEXT.English: Any power must always meet a greater power. Paul Muad'Dib taught this lesson to the Sardaukar on the Plains of Arrakeen. His descendants have yet to learn the lesson for themselves. - The Preacher at Arrakeen
TEXT.French: "Tout pouvoir doit toujours rencontrer une puissance supérieure. Paul Muad'Dib a enseigné cette leçon aux Sardaukars sur les plaines près de Arrakeen. Leurs descendants doivent à présent apprendre cette leçon eux-mêmes." - Le Prêcheur d'Arrakeen

TEXT.English: Spice industry allows you to adopt the Arrakis Spice civic. This civic slows the rate at which spice resources degrade, and allows the spice silo building, which increases your income from each spice resource.

TEXT.English: Melange (me'-lange also ma,lanj) n-s, origin uncertain (thought to derive from ancient Terran Franzh): a. mixture of spices; b. spice of Arrakis (Dune) with geriatric properties first noted by Yanshuph Ashkoko, royal chemist in reign of Shakkad the Wise; Arrakeen melange, found only in deepest desert sands of Arrakis, linked to prophetic visions of Paul Muad'Dib (Atreides), first Fremen Mahdi; also employed by Spacing Guild Navigators and the Bene Gesserit. - Dictionary Royal fifth edition
TEXT.French: "melange (me'-lange, aussi ma,lanj) n-s, origin inconnue (dérivé d'un terme ancient Terrien Franc): a. une.mixture d'Epices; b. Epice d'Arrakis (Dune) possédant des propriétés gériatriques, consigné pour la première fois âr Yanshuph Ashkoko, chimiste royal sous le règne de Shakkad le Sage; Mélange Arrakeen, trouvé uniquement dans les sables les plus profonds du désert d'Arrakis, lié aux visions prophétiques de Paul Muad'Dib (Atreides), le premier Mahdi Fremen; également utilisé par les navigateurs de la Guilde spatiale et les Bene Gesserit." - Dictionaire royal, 5ème édition
